deck: A Quintesson from the Shattered Glass continuity, Aquarius is therefore the exact opposite of traditional greedy and materialistic Quintessons. He loves to explore other races and cultures, sharing his peaceful views with any and everyone.
description: Aquarius's faces are based on real-life individuals for the values the visages represent. The face of "Joy" is based on the face of Buddha, "Compassion" is Martin Luther King, Jr., "Love" is Beatles singer John Lennon, "Peace" is Gandhi, and "Satisfaction" is Grateful Dead singer Jerry Garcia. Satisfaction's colors, however, are an homage to, Dr. Teeth from the Muppets.
name: Aquarius

deck: After witnessing the murder of her mother by an Armtech Soldier Elizabeth Abbot snapped and became the murderous psychopath known as Eris.
description:
Origin:

Once a very promising student on her way to a prestigious school Elizabeth Abbot's life changed when her father lost his money and his life due to the Nomen War. After that her mother went from loser boyfriend to loser boyfriend with Elizabeth getting more and more unhappy. Things took a turn for the worse when her mother began dating an Armtech Soldier called Carl. Carl soon revealed to be an abusive alcoholic, ended up beating Elizabeth and killing her mother during a drunken stupor. When this went to trail Armtech used their resources to make sure Carl got off the charges. This caused Elizabeth to snap. She stalked Carl and one night broke into his house. Tied he and his own mother to a chair and then proceeded to murder his mother in-front of him before slitting his throat.

She was then committed to an insane asylum before escaping and being taken in by the notorious female gang "Daddy's Little Girls" where she became a hardened psychopathic killer. After a few years the terrorist group Pandemonium and its leader Dante saw her potential. She now serves Pandemonium as Dante's personal assassin and has taken up the name Eris.

Powers and Abilities:

Eris is a formidable hand to hand fighter due to her training by "Daddy's Little Girls" and further training with Pandemonium. She also uses various other pieces of technology one of which bares the resemblance to a blue laser-like whip.
name: Eris

volume_credits.name: Last Man Standing: Killbook Of A Bounty Hunter

deck: An inhabitant of the Dreaming concerned with crime and punishment
description:
Origin

Very little is known about Judge Gallows. An inhabitant of the Dreaming concerned with the prosecution and punishment of crime, he was at some point sealed away in a cell in the House of Secrets, presumably as a response to his growing instability.

Creation

Judge Gallows was created by Dave Wood and Curt Swan. he made his first appearance in The Unexpected #113.

Character Evolution

Silver Age

In his original appearance in the late Silver Age, very little was known about Judge Gallows, but he was presumed to be an ordinary human. Once a respected judge, he was forced into retirement because of his increasingly unstable and erratic behaviour, and his growing fixation with delivering his version of justice in even the strangest cases. This remained unchanged through the Bronze Age.

Modern Age

In the Modern Age the character was reimagined as an inhabitant of the Dreaming. It is unclear if any element of his original history was retained in this incarnation.

Major Story Arcs

The Unexpected

Now operating out of a "court" in his basement, Judge Gallows recounts unexpected tales of supernatural and strange cases that were brought before him when he was a judge.

Trial and Error

Judge Gallows is summoned by Abel to try Cain for the multiple murders Cain has committed against Abel. He presides over the resultant trial, and when the jury reaches a verdict of guilty he sentences Cain to be banished from the Dreaming. He refuses to reverse the decision even in the wake of growing instability in the Dreaming and the waking world. When Abel attempts to return Cain to the Dreaming despite his orders, he enters the waking world himself and sentences Cain, Abel, and Matthew to death. Cain goads Gallows into attacking him, which brings the curse of the mark of Cain upon him. He is killed by a taxi which suddenly drives into him.

Powers and Abilities

Judge Gallows is very intelligent, and possesses a fine legal mind. However, he is also dangerously unstable.

Weapons and Equipment

Judge Gallows is generally seen with his gavel, a sentient skull named Bigmouth. Its usefulness, besides as a traditional gavel, is unknown.

issue_credits.name: The Second Possession of Angela Lake / Bruce the Barbarian / A Match Made in Hades
Hang Down Your Head, Joe Mundy / Beware the Killer Clone
Why Was Everyone Afraid of Hester?

name: Judge Gallows

deck: Judge Gallows' sentient gavel.
description:
Origin

Nothing is known about Bigmouth. At some point, it came into the possession of, or was created by, Judge Gallows.

Creation

Bigmouth was created by Dave Wood and Curt Swan. It made its first appearance in The Unexpected #113.

Character Evolution

Silver Age

In the Silver Age, and continuing through the Bronze Age, Bigmouth showed no evidence of sentience. It appeared to be an ordinary gavel, with the whimsical addition of a carved human skull in between the heads.

Modern Age

In the Modern Age, Bigmouth became sentient. No further information was given.

Major Story Arcs

Judge Gallows

Bigmouth is wielded by Judge Gallows during his various trials. It has little input in the proceedings, and rarely even gives evidence as to its sentience.

Powers and Abilities

Bigmouth is a sentient skull which has been crafted into a gavel. Its actual powers are unknown.

issue_credits.name: The Second Possession of Angela Lake / Bruce the Barbarian / A Match Made in Hades
Why Was Everyone Afraid of Hester?

name: Bigmouth

deck: Slipstream is a female Decepticon who fought on Cybertron during the the Autobot/Decepticon war. She is also a member of the Seekers
description:
Origin

Slipstream was one of the Decepticon Seekers who served on the bridge crew of the Nemesis alongside Starscream, Thundercracker and Skywarp. She is one of the clones the Starscream created of himself. Her personality represented Starscream's feminine side to include his considerable strategic thinking, a biting sense of humor, and a short temper.

Creation

Slipstream was created by Cartoon Network for Transformers: Animated (2007) Cartoon by Derrick J. Wyatt. She was first seen in the Kerokero Ace Magazine's Transformers Animated: The Cool manga issue #6 by Naoto Tsushima. Her first US appearance was in Fun Publications' Hasbro Transformers Collectors' Club #48 by writer/editor Pete Sinclair and Jesse Wittenrich. She has also made an appearance in the Transformers: War for Cybertron Game. Slipstream is the first canonical female Seeker.

Major Story Arcs

Kadokawa Shoten

The Cool

As the Autobots and Decepticons fought over the Space Bridge, Starscream chose that moment as the most opportune time to unleash his Clone Army on both factions. Slipstream was the most skilled and as the other clones were being easily overtaken by the joint efforts of Optimus Prime and Megatron, Slipstream managed to get a clear shot at Megatron and sent a powerful energy blast toward him. Megatron saw the attack coming and quickly used Optimus as a living shield.

Defeated, Slipstream was forced to follow Megatron's orders and attack the oncoming Omega Supreme. She and the other clones were greatly outmatched and taken out by a single blast from Omega's arm cannon.

Powers & Weaknesses

Slipstream is one of the fastest flyers of the Decepticons, reaching a speeds of Mach 2.8. She can climb to sub-orbital altitudes of 52 miles and nose-dive to ground level in mere minutes. This makes her especially effective in surprise attacks and hit-and-run tactics. She can shoot cluster bombs up to 40 miles, that can level an area of 10,000 sq feet. Her AGP (Alternating Gyro-Power) Nullifier can interrupt the flow of electricity in any circuity for two minutes. Slipstream overrates herself in situations she can't handle. Her nose-dives can leave to a gyro-circuit overload leaving her disoriented.

Characteristics

  • Allegiance: Decepticon
  • Sub Group: Seeker
  • Function: Warrior/Scout
  • Alt-Modes: Cybertronian Jet, F-16 Fighting Falcon
  • Color Schemes: Gray/Purple/Teal (Games, Animated)

Alternate Versions

Fun Publications

Invasion: Epilogue

Slipstream was playing cards with a number of other bots in Axiom Nexus when both alternate universe Optimus Primes were looking for Depth Charge.

Other Media

Television

Transformers Animated (2007)

Slipstream is one of Starscreams Clones. She possesses considerable strategic thinking.

Episode Appearances

  • A Bridge Too Close, Part I
  • A Bridge Too Close, Part II
  • Endgame, Part I

Video Games

Transformers: War for Cybertron (Xbox 360/PS3/PC)

Slipstream does not appear in the story-line campaign. Completing the Decepticon campaign will allow you to use Slipstream in Escalation mode. Her escalation abilities are cloak and shockwave. Her chassis, labeled a Stalker, for use in multiplayer games as a Decepticon Scientist.

Books

Transformers: Exodus
Transformers: Exiles

deck: Daughter of Sargon the Sorcerer and leader of his cult.
description:
Creation

Sargon the Sorceress was created by writers Ray Fawkes and Jeff Lemire with artist Renato Guedes.

History

Jaimini Sargent was the daughter of John Sargent, the original Sargon the Sorcerer, and a member of the inner circle of the Cult of the Cold Flame. She was supposed to have killed her father in order to gain his power, and one of her first moves with that power was to seek out the three scattered parts of Croyden's Compass - a device designed to seek out sources of magic power. The first of these was the compass' needle, but she found unexpected opposition in retrieving it when she discovered that John Constantine was also seeking it. She was prevented from taking it from him, but managed to kill John's friend Chris in the course of events.

After learning that John had also gained the compass' dial, she began a race for the third piece: the lens. That race took her to London, where she fell victim to a Riddling Butcher whom her own father had trapped within a labyrinth snare. Though she survived, it allowed John the chance to escape with the lens, thereby completing the compass.

Despite their rivalry, Sargon hoped that John would join the Cold Flame - and hid a secret fondness for him from her allies. In a moment at which his life was hanging in the balance, the Cult stole all of his magic items - including the compass - and, hungry for power, she was eager to seek out the sources of magic it could find. Imbued with that new power, she returned to a revived John to mock him. With more power than he, his fate was hers to decide. That fate, it turned out, would be to have sex with her.

This was a part of her plan to gain even more power, as John was soon afterwards attacked by Mister E. She had set both John and Mister E up, though, planting one of John's mystical weapons in the room with the intent that he should use it tokill Mister E, and she and Tannarak would then gain his power. When that plan came to fruition, she once again offered John the chance to join the Cult of the Cold Flame, and though he had an ulterior motive, he accepted.

deck: The current Captain Universe, she was granted her power after a car crash and was recruited into the Avengers.
description:
Origin

Tamara Devoux was involved in a car accident which left her in a coma for 10 years. The Uni-Power then possessed Tamara to become sentient on Earth due to the planet being "significant." It chooses Tamara specifically as it states that both she and the Uni-Power are dying. In the wake of an ambitious plan to expand the horizon of the Avengers, Tamara would be noticed by Tony Stark and Steve Rogers and she would be recruited into the Avengers.

As Captain Universe, Tamara would assist in rescuing an Avengers team from the clutches of an Ex Nihilo, Abyss and Aleph. The former individuals would reluctantly cede to Captain Universe, recognizing its standing within the universe, however the Aleph would attack and subsequently be destroyed. Captain Universe would give Ex Nihilo and Abyss some advice and direction, including that Adam, also Nightmask be sent to Earth. After her first outing as an Avenger, Tamara would go through periods of living as herself with her own views and agency, and switching back to Captain Universe. The martial artists and skilled Avenger Shang Chi, would help Tamara regain her past memories.

Creation

Tamara Devoux was created to be the new Captain Universe in the expanded team of Avengers by Jonathan Hickman. She was first drawn by Jerome Opena and made her first appearance in Avengers #1.

Character Evolution

Tamara Devoux was introduced alongside many new characters and ideas, near the beginning of Jonathan Hickman's multiyear run on Avengers and New Avengers.

Major Story Arcs

The White Event

Captain Universe would empower Adam, transforming him into Nightmask. This would coincide with the White Event empowering a young College student Kevin Conner into Starbrand.

Powers and Abilities

Tamara Devoux, as Captain Universe, possesses incredible superhuman powers and abilities, including generic super strength, enhanced durability, the ability to fly, and energy powers. She can generate and project energy blasts, manipulate limited degrees of matter, of an inorganic and organic nature, transmute and rearrange elements. As Captain Universe, Tamara can also teleport, and can create portals. She also possesses X-Ray vision, telescopic vision, microscopic vision, and Uni vision.

As Captain Universe, she can speak all languages and imbue powers and abilities on to others. As Captain Universe, Tamara also has limited degrees of knowledge of future events. However she is often cryptic and careful about what she reveals, when and to whom.

Physical Characteristics

  • Height: 5'6"
  • Weight: 140 lbs
  • Hair: Black
  • Eyes: Brown

Avengers Universe II: Building Towards Collapse

To The End; Prelude to Infinity
Sent and Received; Prelude to Infinity

deck: Star cheerleader and member of McKinley High School's New Directions show choir. From the TV series Glee.
description:
Please note: This page concerns only the character's comic-book apperances.

When Dilton Doiley discovered the existence of the "Glee-niverse," a parallel world with many similarities to his hometown of Riverdale, he attempted to use his "Portal-Porter" to travel to the alternate universe. Unfortunately, a mishap with the controls resulted in several people from both worlds switching places. Cheerleader Quinn Fabray was among those transported from Lima, Ohio to the world of Riverdale.

description:
Please note: This page concerns only the character's comic-book appearances.

When Dilton Doiley discovered the existence of the "Glee-niverse," a parallel world with many similarities to his hometown of Riverdale, he attempted to use his "Portal-Porter" to travel to the alternate universe. Unfortunately, a mishap with the controls resulted in several people from both worlds switching places. Teacher Will Schuester was among those who remained in his original universe, unexpectedly meeting the strangers from the world of Riverdale.

Archie Meets Glee Part 1: When Worlds Collide

deck: The scatterbrained cheerleader of McKinley High School's New Directions, from the TV series Glee.
description:
Please note: This page concerns only the character's comic-book appearances.

When Dilton Doiley tested his experimental "Portal-Porter" device to create portals to alternate universes, he opened a small "window" in the locker of Brittany S. Pierce, a high school cheerleader in the "Glee-niverse," a parallel universe with many similarities to Dilton's home of Riverdale. The scatterbrained Brittany did not fully understand Dilton's explanation of the parallel worlds, but came to regard him as an "imaginary friend" and told him all about her life in Lima, Ohio.

Eventually, Dilton was ready to physically travel to Brittany's universe. Unfortunately, just at the critical moment, a football thrown by Chuck Clayton accidentally crashed through the window of Dilton's lab, damaging the controls. As a result, instead of just Dilton being transported to Brittany's world, several people from both worlds wound up switching universes; Brittany was among those who were teleported to the world of Riverdale.

deck: A chemistry and physics tutor who offers her help to Otto Octavius/Peter Parker.
description:
Origin

Anna Maria Marconi is a bright-minded, funloving woman born with a growth disorder and remains very little for her age. This did not stop her from taking everything she wanted out of life. She became a student at Empire State University. She met Otto Octavius, in the body of Peter Parker, when the two went on a 'blind-date' together. They soon started dating.

Creation

Anna Maria Marconi was created by Dan Slott and Giuseppe Camuncoli and first fully appeared in Superior Spider-Man issue 5 (2013). She had however appeared one issue before in a cameo. The character is very special for it is one of the few 'little people' to be portrayed in comics in a very real manner with a lot of development in her character.

Major Story Arcs

Building a Company

When Anna Maria joined Peter Parker (with Otto Octavius's mind) in the start-up of his own company, she did not know she would get into a world of trouble. For Otto had become the Superior Spider-Man and took out threads around the city with his Spider-Bods. While Anna Maria and Peter/Otto worked on the company, their romance blossomed and for the first time in both their lives, they felt true love.

Goblin Nation

During the Goblin Army assault on New York, Menace, in her human guise, approached Anna Maria saying that Mary Jane had sent her to get her out of the city safely. Otto also protected her whenever it was neccesary.

Reveals

Eventually, Otto came clean to Anna Maria when she found out that the Peter Parker she had been dating was actually Otto Octavius. This caused a great deal of problems between the two, but Anna Maria remained with Otto/Peter despite of it. When Otto was eventually expelled out of Peter Parker's body, Anna Maria had difficulties adjusting to the new status quo. The man she saw in front of her looked like her boyfriend, but it was actually a completely different person. Peter soon expressed to her that he could not date her and that he was not the same person. Anna Maria on the other hand soon noticed how Peter was less indicisive then Otto.

Working at Parker Industries

The two have remained close friends and Anna Maria now still works at the new Parker Industries. While she does not reveal it, she still has some feelings for Peter/Otto.

deck: A Homicide Detective of the Portland Police Bureau. He's a descendant of a line of guardians called "Grimms." It's his duty to maintain the balance between humans and the mythological creatures hidden in the real world.
description:
From the NBC television show, Grimm.

Nick is from a long line of superhuman hunters, known as Grimms. Much of folklore and fairy tales, such as the original Brothers Grimm stories, are based on accounts of supernatural creatures known as Wesen. Wesen are half-human/half-beast creatures with the ability to hide among normal humans. Grimms can see them, however, and spent millenia hunting Wesen to protect ordinary humans. However, Grimms have developed a reputation for killing Wesen on sight, causing many Wesen fear Nick when they realize what he is, which can be as much a hindrance in investigations as an advantage.

Powers

As a Grimm, Nick is gifted with the ability to see Wesen when other humans cannot. However, this is only possible when they experience emotional stress, otherwise they look like ordinary human beings. What's more, Wesen can recognize Nick for what he is when he sees their true forms. Nick possesses genetic knowledge of hand-to-hand and weapons combat, learning new weapons quickly and often pulling off complex martial arts moves on instinct. He is stronger than he appears but not by much and is apparently resistant against supernatural compulsions (although Nick was still susceptible to the enthralling of the muse-like Wesen, the Musai). Additionally, Nick can usually profile people with uncanny accuracy based on a short glance. All Grimms appear to be good sketch artists. However, Nick is new to his heritage and still has a lot to learn.
name: Nick Burkhardt

deck: Possibly the Greatest Hero of Ooo.
description:
Origin

Billy is the most notable hero in all of OOo, having once single handedly defeated the Lich and saved all of OOo. After the battle Billy fell into a deep depression, becoming jaded, passive and introspective.

Weapons

  • Gauntlet: Billy has a gauntlet, which he used to do battle with the Lich. It is not known whether or not it has special abilities.
  • Nothung: Billy's sword, which he can summon by calling its name. It also opens Billy's legendary crack, which serves as an entrance to his secret home.
name: Billy

deck: A spy for the Crime Syndicate who infiltrated A.R.G.U.S. and the ,Justice, League in order to weaken Superman, and facilitate the Crime Syndicate's invasion, of Earth. And is the girlfriend of Johnny Quick
description:
Creation

Rhonda Pineda was created by writer Geoff Johns, with her first making an appearance in DC's The New 52 FCBD Special Edition in 2012, though not properly introducing her until the next year in Justice League #18.

Major Story Arcs

Joining the Justice League

Rhonda Pineda began to assist the Justice League during Throne of Atlantis, when the Atlanteans invaded the surface world, lead by Aquaman's brother Ocean Master. Rhonda was one of the many heroes to answer the call for assistance, though no one noticed her due to her size. She played a key roll in disarming the bombs that would have sunk Boston into the Atlantic Ocean. She came to the League's attention and received an invitation to their satellite to join other would-be candidates for an expanded League. She made her power known after assisting in disabling a malfunctioning Platinum and capturing her value resonmeter. She was a student at Ivy University.

It was later revealed after a battle with Despero that she had been an agent for Amanda Waller the whole time. Waller intended her to be the JLA's counter to Element Woman . She infiltrated the team (again, through Waller's interference) to spy on her new teammates Firestorm and Element Woman with the mission to discover how to render their respective powers inoperable in battle. She was one of the only people aware of an impending war.

Trinity War

It was finally revealed that that Rhonda is actually from the Earth 3, the home of the Crime Syndicate of America. She worked with the The Outsider to frame Superman for the murder of Arthur Light by going into Superman's brain and using a sliver of Kryptonite from Batman's ring to hit a nerve and trigger his heat vision. This is what was subsequently weakening Superman throughout the arc. It was revealed that she told Cyborg that she was the spy on the team and mentioning that she was the one who went into Superman's ear drum, into his brain, to set off the heat vision that killed Dr. Light. Cyborg was going to tell the team, but, before he could, his cybernetic body, badly damaged by Atomica, split from his remaining biological elements and formed the super villain named Grid. The Justice League and Justice League of America were in shock and fell quickly to Atomica's true allies the Crime Syndicate from Earth 3.

Forever Evil

After the events of Trinity War, the Crime Syndicate begin wreaking havoc upon the world. Without the three Justice League teams to fight against them, other hero teams are forced to step up. The Teen Titans decide to directly engage in combat with Johnny Quick and Atomica but are quickly defeated and sent into the future by Johnny Quick. The Doom Patrol is another team that decides to step up, however, they too are defeated when Johnny Quick and Atomica seemingly kill of Scorch, Karma, and Negative Woman.

During the events of Forever Evil: Rogues Rebellion, Atomica and Johnny Quick are sent after the Rogues. When they catch up to them, the Rogues are already fighting The Royal Flush Gang, but this doesn't stop Atomica and Quick from stepping in and taking control. When some cops show up Atomica jumps into one of their heads and grows making his head explode. When Weather Wizard concentrates on stopping Quick Atomica shrinks and hides. Before Quick can defeat Wizard him and Atomica are called back to the Syndicate's headquarters.

When Luthor's Injustice League team along with Batman infiltrate the fallen Watchtower, Captain Cold freezes and smashes one of Johnny Quick's legs. Cold and Black Manta also release the prisoner the Crime Syndicate was holding, who is revealed to be Alexander Luthor. Alexander then calls upon the power of Mazahs and a lightning bolt strikes the compound, Alexander then proceeds to kill Johnny Quick by snapping his neck and stealing his powers. Atomica is knocked out under a pile of rubble caused by the explosion and wakes up after the battle is over. She appears shocked and states that her size changing belt has been shorted out and she is stuck in a smaller form, asks where Johnny Quick is but Lex Luthor tells her that he is dead and proceeds to squash her with his foot, and thereby killing her.

Personality

Originally she was described by Cyborg and other members of the League as a shy, but heroic, young girl. She has been shown to use her powers for the purpose of going into video games.

She pretended to show regret for her loyalty to Amanda Waller, even offering to give her suit up to "atone" for the things she did at Waller's behest. It was eventually revealed to be a complicated ruse due to her deceptive, and arguably evil, nature.

Although she initially seemed like a kind, loyal member of the League, it had all been an act. She was actually a cruel and deceitful member of the Crime Syndicate of America.

deck: An artificial human created by Ex Nihilo who was endowed with cosmic powers by the White Event.
description:
Origin

Adam was created in The Garden on Mars by Ex Nihilo in order to form a new human race. After a battle, Adam was taken back to Earth by the Avengers who took him in and attempted to understand him. Captain Universe later decoded his language and granted him the ability to speak English.

Adam warned that a White Event was coming, and when it did engulfed New York City and imbued Adam with the powers of Nightmask.

Creation

This iteration of Nightmask was created by writer Jonathan Hickman and penciler Jerome Opeña, and appeared first appeared in the 2013 Avengers series.

Major Story Arcs

Once rescued by the Avengers, Tony Stark attempts to understand his language, mistakenly believing his name to be Blackveil. Originally Nightmask could only speak Builder Machine Code, a coded language revealed at the end of Avengers #6, until Captain Universe used her powers on him so that he could be understood by the Avengers and warn them of the coming White Event.

After the Last White Event, Nightmask explains that the event has altered him in order to shepherd in the ascension of the universe, and begins to track down other areas on Earth that the event reached, in order to locate other humans that have been affected.

Nightmask locates another area affected by the White Event at a College in the United States. Leading the Avengers to it, they discover all that remains is a young man named Kevin Connor who has been given the power of the Star Brand. After a short battle between Kevin and the Avengers, Nightmask stops the fight and teleports Kevin away to the Superflow of the Universe, explaining what has happened to him. He then teleports once again, leading the new Star Brand to Mars and confronting Ex Nihilo.

deck: Daughter of a scientist, she used her fathers inventions to become a criminal.
description:
Origin

After her mother died, her father vowed vengeance on the superheroes he claimed killed his wife. As a scientist, he began making weapons for the criminals. With his daughter, he was constantly on the move and evading the law. One day, he left his daughter alone. She used his inventions to continue his quest for revenge on superheroes. As a member of U.N.I.C.O.R.N. she encountered Critter and The Core. Soon, it became apparent that she was no hardened criminal, but secretly a hero at heart.

Creation

Cricket was created by Tom Hutchison.
name: Cricket

deck: Horror movie slasher, cannibalistic killer, who wields a chainsaw and wears a mask made of human skin.
description:
Texas Chainsaw Massacre

Leatherface is considered to be the main antagonist through out the Texas Chainsaw Massacre series of films and comics, due to him appearing in every film so far, and he is the one who actually wields a chainsaw to kill people, so in a way he is the one who gives the franchise its name. Due to this reason he has become a horror icon, amongst the likes of other horror slashers, such as Jason Voorhees, Freddy Krueger and Michael Myers.

In the original film he once worked at a slaughter factory as a cow killer, presumably along with his other family members. In the original set of films he was never seen without one of his masks on. He was incapable of proper speech and instead simply "spoke" in grunts and howls, but was perfectly capable of understanding other people and his families orders.

He and his family use the bones of their victims and animals to make furniture.

Unlike fellow slashers, he does not come across as sadistic or "evil", more so he does what he does because he simply doesn't understand the concepts of right or wrong, or rather he has no concepts of such. Gunnar Hansen (who played the character in the first film) describes him as "completely under the control of his family. He will do whatever they tell him to do.He is a little bit afraid of them." and Tobe Hooper in the documentary The Shocking Truth portrays him as a "big baby" who kills in self defense, because he feels threatened, in the first film he shows fear when new people enter his home.

Leatherface is mentally impaired this combined with his upbringing has shaped the chainsaw wielding murderer he is. Not much back story is given in regards to his early life as a child though.

Dead Skin Mask

The character is never seen without one of his masks on, which he fashions from the faces of his victims. This is probably the reason why he has the name "Leatherface" though in the first film he is not referred to as such.

He could wear the masks due to his inability to properly express himself with speech. He wears a variety of masks in the first film, the "killing mask" the one he wears for most of the film and when he hunts people down, the "grandmother" mask, which he wears along with a different apron, perhaps when he wants to be more domestic and the "pretty lady mask" that he wears to diner along with a suit, dressing up for dinner is a Southern tradition, so it shows the character southern roots. Each mask could represent a different "mood", or personality.

Tools of The Trade

Leatherface's main and primary weapon is his chainsaw, though he also uses a variety of other weapons, such as meat hooks, knives, and hammers.

The chainsaw model that was used in the original was either a Poulan 306a or a Poulan 245. Which was made. The logos on the chainsaw were covered with tape to avoid any lawsuits. The chainsaw was also modified as well. So whichever model it actually is it was modified for the film.

In the sequel Leatherface wields a Craftsman 4300.

Part of The Family

Leatherface has quite a large family more and more members appear in each movie and in the comics.

Working at the slaughter house apparently ran through the family since, their Grandpa who is a supercentenarian worked there and was considered very good at his job. Other family members include his brothers Nubbins Sawyer (The Hitchhiker) Drayton Sawyer (The Old Man), the owner of a gas station named "Last Chance" who seems to be the eldest, the victims flesh are processed and made into barbecues and chilli, which Drayton then sells, and presumably they also eat as well, he is referred to as either "the cook" or "the old man". It is never explicitly specified what relation Drayton is to Bubba and Nubbins.

In the Texas Chainsaw Massacre two his brother Chop Top a Vietnam veteran who has a metal plate embedded into his skull, which is likely due to an injury he sustained during the conflict.

All the family seems to be mentally deranged and are totally inept of empathy and understanding for their victims. They take great pleasure in "playing with their food" before murdering and eating them.
name: Bubba Sawyer

deck: Tigerhawk is a Maximal and emissary of the Vok
description:
History

Origin

Tigerhawk was formed when the Vok aliens de-Sparked and fused the bodies of Tigatron and Airazor together. They intended to create a super warrior they could control and bring justice to the time-disrupting Transformers on prehistoric Earth. Unfortunately when the two extracted Sparks united and entered Tigerhawk's body, he found a different purpose and a unique personality emerged.

Alternate Versions

Razorclaw is a former Maximal from an alternate Beast Wars Universe who became a Minion of Unicron. Tigerhawk that was corrupted by the Vok to become Razorclaw, and then killed his universe's Megatron. Unicron abducted Razorclaw to be his fourth and final general.
name: Tigerhawk

deck: Anti-Blaze was a member of the Mini-Con Council of Sages
name: Anti-Blaze

deck: Mara is a warrior of the Lemurian Rebel Army who is attracted to Hulk - but not to Bruce Banner.
description:
Current Events

Mara helps rescue Hulk from Attuma's undersea monster and is impressed by his strength. However she finds Bruce Banner weak and unattractive. She is supposed to marry Canor but does not really want to.

Origin

Little is known of Mara's origin apart from the fact that she is a Lemurian warrior and is betrothed to Canor. She is part of the Lemurian rebel army who usurp Attuma's rule.

Creation

Mara was created by writer Mark Waid and penciler Leinil Yu. She first appeared in Indestructible Hulk #5 (Apr. 2013).
name: Mara

deck: Canor is the leader of the Lemurian Rebel Army who aim to regain their land from Attuma.
description:
Current Events

Canor and Mara, with the aid of Hulk, recently led the Lemurian Rebel Army to overthrow the rule of Attuma.

Creation

Canor was created by writer Mark Waid and penciler Leinil Yu. She first appeared in Indestructible Hulk #5 (Apr. 2013).
name: Canor

deck: A priest in Gotham who doesn't like Bruce Wayne policies but works with Batman.
description: Father Paul Tenney works at St. Dimas with Monsignor Carl D'Angelo in the Devil's Ridge district. He works with Batman on finding the murder of Father Richter. He has been a man of violence in the past but has tried to turn away from it since he is a priest.
name: Paul Tenney

volume_credits.name: Legends of the Dark Knight 100-Page Super Spectacular

deck: Big Macintosh is Applejack and Apple Bloom's older brother. He barely talks usually only saying eeyup and nope when others talk to him.
description:
Eldest child of the Apple family, Big Mac is a quiet, hard-working stallion, who spends his days bucking apple trees and hauling carts. He usually doesn't say more than the occasional "yup" and "nope," but when the story focuses on him, he has been known to be quite articulate.

He began to feel insecure and sad that Applejack was the "hero" of the Apple family, as she and the other ponies who represent the Elements of Harmony are always running off to save Equestria, while he's just on the farm doing chores. Desperate to once again be a hero to his youngest sister Applebloom, Big Mac disguised himself as a mare, cousin Orchard Blossom, so he could compete in the Sisterhooves Social and help Applebloom win a blue ribbon (when Applejack wasn't available). They didn't win, so he felt bad, but Applebloom assured him that he will always be a hero to her.

He is a member of the Ponytones, a singing ensemble. He provides the bass voice.

deck: An independent contractor who works for super-powered parents.
description:
Current Events

Sherry had assisted the Immortal and Dupli-Kate through Kate's pregnancy and the delivery of their twins. She was recommended by Cecil to assist Mark and Eve as they deal with her pregnancy and any irregularities that might develop. To prevent any toxins developing that might hurt the baby, she recommends Eve stop using her powers immediately.

Powers and Abilities

Sherry has X-Ray vision which she has used to inspect babies still in the womb. She claims that it shows more than an ultrasound.
name: Sherry

deck: A Popular background Pony who is seen with her friend Sweetie Drops (Bon Bon).
description:
Creation

Lyra Heartstrings is one of many of the stock background characters of My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic, who has gained popularity among the fandom over the years. Lyra first appeared in the first episode of the series and since then has appeared in the background or in various crowd shots in various locations throughout the series. The main thing Lyra is famous for in the fandom is the scene in episode seven "Dragonshy" where she is seen siting on a bench in a human like position. Since this scene the fandom has inspired the popular meme about Lyra having a human obsession, particularly hands. Other than this she is always seen around a earth pony named Sweetie Drops (Bon Bon) which has led to shipping in the fandom.

IDW Comics

Lyra has also appeared in the comics for the series first appearing the during "The Return of Queen Chrysalis" story arc as one of the many ponies in Ponyville who have been replaced by a Changeling.

deck: The current Grandmaster of the Court of Owls.
description:
Creation

John Wycliffe was created by Talon writers James Tynion IV and Scott Snyder. He was designed by artist Guillem March.

Major Story Arcs

Talon

John Wycliffe became the Grandmaster of the Court of Owls after Lincoln March poisoned over twenty-three members of the Court. The Court decided to take things in a new direction which meant killing the former Grandmaster Sebastian Clark. However, Clark had already fled before they got the chance. After being subdued by Nathaniel O'Malley, Calvin Rose was escorted to Wycliffe by O'Malley, his father and grandfather where all of this was revealed to Rose, who had believed he was helping Clark destroy the Court rather than having been working for the former Grandmaster all along.

issue_credits.name: Don't be Afraid of the Dark

name: John Wycliffe
